title: Congratulating Mr. and Mrs. Alvin Barthel upon the occasion of celebrating their 70th Wedding Anniversary
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  congratulating  Mr. and Mrs. Alvin Barthel upon
the occasion of celebrating their 70th Wedding Anniversary

WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body to celebrate  impres-
sive  milestones achieved by couples who reside within this great Empire
State; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to congratu-
late Mr. and Mrs. Alvin Barthel upon the occasion of  celebrating  their
70th  Wedding  Anniversary  on  Tuesday,  January 25, 2011; in 1941, the
couple was married in The Little Church Around the Corner, New York, New
York; and
  WHEREAS, Knowing each other almost all of  their  lives,  93  year-old
Alvin  and  95 year-old Ruthene grew up together in Upstate New York and
have been side by side through all of their lives' endeavors; and
  WHEREAS, Alvin Barthel enlisted in the United States  military  during
World  War  II; near the end of the war, he was sent to Japan as part of
the occupation; at the same time, Ruthene was also doing her part as  an
American;  she  joined  the  workforce and was proud to be a part of the
Rosie the Riveters generation; and
  WHEREAS, The following year, Alvin, who was still in Japan,  sent  for
his  bride; Ruthene excitedly packed up the house in Merrick and went to
join him; the Barthels lived abroad for 18 months, experiencing the  joy
of  the  birth  of their only child, their wonderful daughter, Nancy Jo;
and
  WHEREAS, Alvin and Ruthene Barthel then returned to Merrick, New York,
to the comfort of their friends and family members to raise their daugh-
ter and enjoy their life together; Alvin established  his  own  business
and Ruthene devotedly served as his secretary; and
  WHEREAS,  Alvin Barthel, affectionately known as Bart, and his devoted
wife, Ruthene Barthel, lovingly known  as  Tot,  are  pillars  in  their
community;  they  have  been  instrumental  in  creating and cultivating
several Kiwanis events as well as other occasions within  the  community
of  Merrick,  their  happy home, for almost three quarters of a century;
and
  WHEREAS, Alvin and Ruthene Barthel are and always have been a tower of
strength, support, understanding and limitless love  for  their  family;
and
  WHEREAS,  Their love, devotion, caring, sensitivity and responsiveness
to their family, friends and all who know them are  their  hallmark  and
tradition; and
  WHEREAS,  Alvin  and  Ruthene  Barthel have lived and continue to live
their lives with great dignity and genuine grace, always demonstrating a
deep and continuing concern for human  values  and  ideals,  and  in  so
doing, they have inspired others to do the same; and
  WHEREAS, This meaningful occasion is the result of the love, hard work
and spirit this couple has invested in their marriage; and
  WHEREAS,  These  same  values  they  have  passed to their loved ones,
producing a family that is close-knit and supportive of  its  individual
members,  public-minded  in its relations to the community and committed
to the ideals of citizenship upon which this Nation was founded; and
  WHEREAS, Alvin and Ruthene Barthel have touched  the  lives  of  their
family  and  many friends through the shining example of their marriage,
which is a testament to the devotion and admiration which  they  possess
for one another; and
  WHEREAS,  The  longevity of this enduring marriage truly marks a mile-
stone in life's journey, an event of personal triumph and joy; and

  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that when  an  occa-
sion  of such importance is brought to our attention, the same should be
memorialized by us for the edification and  emulation  of  others;  now,
therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
congratulate Mr. and Mrs. Alvin Barthel upon the occasion of celebrating
their 70th Wedding Anniversary; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Mr. and Mrs. Alvin Barthel, Merrick, New York.
